lead_paragraph: A strike by pilots at the airline has caused travel problems in Europe and threatened to damage Germany’s longstanding cooperation between management and labor.

byline.contributor: Jack Ewing and Rhea Wessel contributed reporting from Frankfurt.

headline.print_headline: Lufthansa, Its Pilots on Strike, Joins Germany’s List of Companies in Distress
headline.main: Lufthansa Joins Germany’s List of Companies in Distress

snippet: A strike by pilots at the airline has caused travel problems in Europe and threatened to damage Germany’s longstanding cooperation between management and labor....
abstract: Continuing strike by Lufthansa pilot's union over wages has put airline under significant stress, with nearly 4,500 flights canceled over six-day period and no end to strike in sight; Lufthansa's plight underscores way in which efficiency and competence of some major German corporations have tumbled, along with decades of cooperation between labor and management across country.
